original: Lundgren, Thord, läroverksadjunkt, Skövde, f. 28/12/87 i Skallmeja, Ska-rab. 1., av lantbr. Vilhelm Henrik L. o. Anna Maria Sandwall. G. 28 m. Märta Brusewitz. Barn: Gunnar f. 31. — Mog:ex. i Karlstad 07, fil. kand. i Upps. 10, fil. mag. 11, pro vår v. Gbgs real 15. Vik. adj. i Karlstad 12-15, e. o. vid Gbgs real 16-21, adj. i Mariestad 21, i eng. o. franska v. Skövde h. a. 1. sed. 31. Sekr. i All. frangaise i Skövde 32-37, styr :led. i Skövde föreläsn rfören. sed. 38, suppl. i styr. f. Skövde human. förb. samt i Skövde folksk:styr. Res. t. Tyskl. 08, Engl. 10, Frankr., Belg. o. Tyskl. 14, Frankr. 20, 33, 36, Frankr. o. Ital. 30, Schweiz 38 o. 47. Övers. A. Daudet: Lettres de mon moulin (31), utg. Bour-det: Vient de paraitre, acte I (kom-ment. skoluppl. 36), Textes frangais (dito 39), tidniart. RVO.
translated: Lundgren, Thord, high school teacher, Skövde, b. 28/12/87 in Skallmeja, Ska-rab. 1st, son of farmer Vilhelm Henrik L. and Anna Maria Sandwall. Married on 28th to Märta Brusewitz. Children: Gunnar b. 31. — Completed middle school in Karlstad in 1907, Bachelor of Arts in Uppsala in 1910, Master of Arts in 1911, worked at Gothenburg's real school from 1915. Substitute teacher in Karlstad from 1912-1915, temporary teacher at Gothenburg's real school from 1916-1921, teacher in Mariestad in 1921, teaching English and French at Skövde from 1931. Secretary of the Alliance Française in Skövde from 1932-1937, board member of Skövde lecture association since 1938, substitute on the board of Skövde Humanist Association and Skövde primary school board. Traveled to Germany in 1908, England in 1910, France, Belgium, and Germany in 1914, France in 1920, 1933, 1936, France and Italy in 1930, Switzerland in 1938 and 1947. Translated A. Daudet's "Lettres de mon moulin" (31), published Bourdet's "Vient de paraitre, acte I" (commentary school edition in 1936), "Textes frangais" (ditto 1939), newspaper articles recipient of Royal Order of Vasa.
